heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour was the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 06 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (183°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 51.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 2.5°C) and outside temperature (up 1.6°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 10%) and rainfall (up 0.7 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 900 m), light levels (up 10148 lux), and pressure (up 9 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 8955 lux), cloud levels (up 1031 m), and rainfall (down 0.2 mm) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 900.2m lower than yesterday, 209.7m lower than the past week, 1030.5m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 737m and a high of 4780m, averaging 1493.5m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; the temperature will feel pleasantly warm. Also, the air will feel noticeably humid and uncomfortable and very little to no wind will be present. Rain showers likely, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and some sunny spells will occur. Weather could become unsettled.
